__e: The captain here hasn't only given us the best food and looked after the ship his own self at all times but he saved my life by that operation at sea.
If I hadn't known you'd taken that pilot single-handed, I'd say you were scared.
Nevertheless, the fact remains... that others, not you, have taken care of the boy since he was an infant.
Since I was a little boy, you took care of me as if I were your own son.
.. happening or what he wants out of me, or anything like that. But he took care of me.
Ever since the day you thought I was a woman of the street. You took me in, cared for me,
How can you, when he got so sick nursing you?
Who was the man that took care of you for 25 years?
The man that looked after you since you were 14, was he a White Russian?
You've been bailing your old man out of trouble for years... but he doesn't need you anymore.
.. happening or what he wants out of me, or anything like that. But he took care of me.
Ever since the day you thought I was a woman of the street. You took me in, cared for me,
If she took care of him, he must've told her.
Nobody cared about him. He was all alone. But he had God, which is more than many young people have today.
All these years you've been tending it like a child getting it ready for the great day!
That kid took care of my Rosa... my n nos
Jack is so pleased with the way your husband's handled his account.
My daughter brought you back here and tended your wound, Sir Ivanhoe.
Well, that takes care of that, doesn't it?
You handled that in a very thoughtful way.
Oh, I think you've taken care of that already, sir.
We always took such good care of each other.
Lord Frith, I know you've looked after us well... and it's wrong to ask even more of you.
Offhand I'd say he took excellent care of you.
